explanation: memchr - the target function calls memchr repeatedly; include its declaration/definition to confirm behavior (it searches bytes, not compare strings) and to make sure no project macro shadows it with memcmp-like behavior. memcmp - the MISRA rule concerns use of memcmp; include its declaration and any project aliases so the analyzer can detect any direct or indirect use (or redefinitions/wrappers) that compare null‑terminated strings. MHD_add_response_entry_no_check_ - this is the single callee returned by add_response_entry_n; include its implementation/declaration to check whether it (transitively) uses memcmp (or an alias) to compare null‑terminated strings, because a violation in a callee constitutes a violation reachable from the target function.
